title: BMU holds workshop on structured clinical assessment
body: A workshop on ‘Structured Clinical Assessment (SCA)’ was held at the Department of Clinical Oncology of Bangladesh Medical University on Thursday. The workshop was inaugurated by vice-chancellor Professor Md Shahinul Alam as chief guest of the event. In his speech, the VC said that SCA is a very important initiative in improving the quality of education, modernising the assessment system and producing experts of international standard. It will provide scientific and reliable guidance to assess the clinical skills, decision-making ability and quality of patient-centered care of students, he added. The event was presided over by Professor Syed Md Akram Hossain, chairman of the Department of Clinical Oncology. He said that BMU was committed to producing competent, ethical and internationally-standard oncology specialists, and the modern assessment system will further strengthen that effort. The faculty session of the workshop was conducted by Professor Tahmina Begum, counselor and director, Department of Medical Education, Md Russell Ahmed, assistant professor, Medical Education, Public Health and Informatics, BMU. The participants of the daylong workshop received hands-on training on the philosophy of SCA, station development, assessment rubric, objective scoring and feedback system. The workshop was attended by teachers from the Department of Clinical Oncology, BMU, National Cancer Research Institute, Dhaka CMH Cancer Centre, Department of Radiotherapy, Dhaka Medical College, and teachers from the departments of Clinical Oncology, Radiation Oncology and Medical Oncology of various institutions in the country.
